interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands, with Honshu being the largest.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 km.
Australia is home to the world's largest living structure, the Great Barrier Reef.
Brazil is the only country in South America where Portuguese is the official language.
India has the world's highest number of post offices, with over 150,000 locations.
Norway is home to the world's longest road tunnel, the Lærdal Tunnel, which is 24.5 km long.
Egypt is home to the only remaining Wonder of the Ancient World, the Great Pyramid of Giza.
China has the world's largest high-speed rail network, spanning over 40,000 km.
South Africa has three capital cities, each serving a different branch of government.
Iceland runs almost entirely on renewable energy, mainly geothermal and hydroelectric power.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
